message: I need to find somewhere safe, so I head for the door at the back of the ballroom.
Behind the door is a staircase. I climb to the next floor, keeping an ear out for any guards who might be following me.
My headache gets worse with each step I take, but I somehow manage to keep moving.
Shit. Getting dizzy...
My strength gives out as I reach the landing. I stumble into the wall and slide to the floor.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Haah, haa..."
Desperate, I dig through my bag for my pills.
I quickly cram a few down my throat, hoping they'll work fast.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Urgh..."
Sweat streams down my forehead to my chin.
All I can do now is wait for it to work.
I'm still breathing hard when I open my bag and set Ren in my lap.
I try to start him up again, but his limp body won't move.
My heart aches to see him this way.
What happened to you, Ren?
I open my Coil to check his status.
The diagnostic is a mess of error messages. Basically, nothing is working.
I try to use the diagnostic tool to restart him, but that doesn't work either.
Exhausted beyond measure, I close the diagnostic and hug Ren tight.
Like this, Ren is little more than a stuffed animal, an empty shell. It's unbearable.
What if... What if I can't bring him back?
I'll do what I can, but Ren's an old model, so a lot of his parts are out of production.
I can't imagine having an Allmate... a partner, other than Ren.
Something I've always taken for granted is slipping away. Reality is an inescapable mire of despair.
It's not like I've never thought about living without Ren, but imagining it is totally different from having it actually happen.
I'm only now starting to realize how much I depend on him.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What the hell am I supposed to do now?!"
When I close my eyes, a familiar face comes to mind.
Granny...
What am I supposed to do?

name: タエ
message: "No matter what happens, do not falter. Believe in the path you chose and keep pushing forward."
Believe in the path I chose and keep pushing forward...
...That's right. I can't stop here.
I have to stop Toue and save everyone back home.
No matter how much it hurts, I can't hesitate.
I put Ren in my bag and climb to my feet.
My headache is still going strong, but I start back up the stairs anyway.
I need to get higher.
I need to get to Toue.
I don't have a choice. I'm the only one who can stop him.
I make my way up the stairs one step at a time, using the wall to support myself.
...After what feels like forever, I find my path blocked by a door.
Is this the top floor?
I approach the authentication screen and present the ID I pulled off that guard at the service entrance.
